intro: Nothoscordum empedradense, commonly known as the rock garlic, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers, which are typically borne on tall, slender stems. It thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
